subject: Re: [junit] Making JUnit more pluggable for add-ons
msgSnippet: ... JUnitPerf attempts to something similar - start a timer immediately before the test executes and stop the timer immediately after the test completes.
messageBody:
Michael Silverstein wrote:

>
> Wrapping test execution
> -----------------------
> I need to be able to start profiling immediately before a user test starts
> and end profiling immediately afterward. One approach is to wrap the user
> test class that is presently instantiated in
> junit.runner.BaseTestRunner.getTest(String) with a TestDecorator subclass
> instance that manages profiling during test execution. Creating the
> decorator sounds like a job for factory method [Gamma95].

JUnitPerf attempts to something similar - start a timer immediately before the
test executes and stop the timer immediately after the test completes. However,
the granularity of test decoration offered by the TestDecorator includes the
time associated with setting up and tearing down the test fixture. In other
words, decorating the Test.run() method includes the overhead of setUp() and
tearDown().

I'm not sure how you're defining profiling, but I wanted to make you were aware
of the implications of decoration and how it relates to the life cycle of test
execution.

Mike
